channel.title: RS/Java Dependancies?
channel.description:
I have stripped Windows XP down to bare minimum and RS fails to load, i only have IE and MS Java. It creates UID.dat and then tries to download the game files (this is where it fails i think). This all happens while the screen is grey and then IE just crashes.
Before you start yelling FIREFOX + SUN JAVA, its not the problem, its because something is missing from my system.
Running the game as Unsigned works however.
So does anyone know why it crashes with signed applet?
EDIT: just tried a fresh install with ALL services intact, no luck.

item.title: RS/Java Dependancies?
item.dc:creator: @1337h4x 1337h4x
item.description:
@1337h4x wrote:

[quote=“Krichevskoy, post:9, topic:106739”]MS Java hasn’t been updated in how long? Oh, right, four years.

[quote=12 September 2003]
The MSJVM will reach its end of life on December 31, 2007. Customers are encouraged to take proactive measures to stay informed about obsolete software and move away from the MSJVM in a timely fashion. The MSJVM is no longer available for distribution from Microsoft and there will be no enhancements to the MSJVM. Microsoft products and SKUs currently including the MSJVM will continue to be retired or replaced by versions not containing the MSJVM.
[/quote][/quote]I thought MS stopped messing with java waaay back when during the argument. Btw krisch I’m still waiting for those tuts >.>

Read full topic

item.title: RS/Java Dependancies?
item.dc:creator: @Krichevskoy Krichevskoy
item.description:
@Krichevskoy wrote:

MS Java hasn’t been updated in how long? Oh, right, four years.

The MSJVM will reach its end of life on December 31, 2007. Customers are encouraged to take proactive measures to stay informed about obsolete software and move away from the MSJVM in a timely fashion. The MSJVM is no longer available for distribution from Microsoft and there will be no enhancements to the MSJVM. Microsoft products and SKUs currently including the MSJVM will continue to be retired or replaced by versions not containing the MSJVM.

item.title: RS/Java Dependancies?
item.dc:creator: @kripz kripz
item.description:
@kripz wrote:

[quote=“frank_, post:7, topic:106739”][quote author=kripz link=topic=152778.msg1440777#msg1440777 date=1181137341]
try reading
[/quote]just because it isnt installed doesnt mean you cant select it.[/quote]

i was talking Greeny.

Anyway, it was Direct X, if i remove it RS/IE crashes.

Ive reduced windows to about 250mb and it only uses 32mb of ram, more VM’s

EDIT: and for future reference, selecting MS java only loads a page where it tells you how to set up MS java as default, ill assume its the same for sun java, cant load rs to test, website seems to be down.

Read full topic

item.title: RS/Java Dependancies?
item.dc:creator: @kripz kripz
item.description:
@kripz wrote:

Greeny:

Fresh XP install, Fresh Firefox install, Fresh Java install.

try reading

frank_:

you are more than likely trying to run the sun java version, try selecting ms java on the detail select page

sun java is not even installed.

Ive narrowed it down to some specific components, ill guess its either midi support, direct X or open GL or something.

Read full topic

item.title: RS/Java Dependancies?
item.dc:creator: @Rictoo Rictoo
item.description:
@Rictoo wrote:

EDIT: just tried a fresh install with ALL services intact, no luck.
You reinstalled Windows and it still didn't work? Can't happen.

You might have a limited User Account on XP which doesn’t allow you to place files into \WINDOWS, I’m not sure.

Read full topic
